thread.title: Great Lakes steamboat docks in Buffalo; restoration planned
thread.title_full: Great Lakes steamboat docks in Buffalo; restoration planned - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi.com
title: Great Lakes steamboat docks in Buffalo; restoration planned
text:
BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) â€” An old Great Lakes steamboat that operated as a passenger ferry for decades is now temporarily berthed in Buffalo while en route to New York City for restoration.
The SS Columbia arrived last week in western New York, where it will remain docked at Silo City on Buffalo's Lake Erie waterfront for the next year. While in Buffalo, the 113-year-old vessel will host celebrations, dockside tours, education programs and other functions.
Launched in the early 20th century, the Columbia ferried passengers from downtown Detroit to an amusement park across the border in Canada. The plans call for towing it to New York City, where the vessel will undergo restoration.
The Columbia is a sister ship to the SS Canadiana, which took passengers from Buffalo to an amusement park in Ontario, Canada. The Canadiana was scrapped in 2004.
